EIB - Eastern Neighbourhood Microfinance TA Programme

EIP - Idanaabruse mikrofinantseerimise tehnilise abi programm
EIP - Itäisten naapurimaiden mikrorahoitusta koskeva teknisen tuen ohjelma
BEI - Programme d’assistance technique pour les opérations de microfinance dans les pays du voisinage oriental
BEI - Eastern Neighbourhood Microfinance TA Programme
EIB - Program tehničke pomoći u području mikrofinanciranja država istočnog susjedstva

TI_DOC.P: EIB - Eastern Neighbourhood Microfinance TA Programme (LU-Luxembourg)

TXT_MARK.P: TA2018018 R0 NIF
Restricted international tender
Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
General Budget of the Union through the Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
Fee-based

The following TA programme is linked to the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area (DCFTA) Agreement, signed between the European Commission (EC) and the European Investment Bank (EIB) on 19.12.2016. The DCFTA Initiative East is a facility aimed at supporting economic growth and employment-generating activities in Georgia, Ukraine and Moldova. The DCFTA facility comprises customised technical assistance to counterpart Financial Institutions (FIs) in the 3 aforementioned countries.
The main purpose of this technical assistance is to ensure that:
i. Loans are fully allocated to creditworthy micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs);
ii. The FIs are sustainable organisations capable to continue MSME lending after project completion and are able to diversify their range of financial services and products to this market segment;
iii. The final beneficiaries (MSMEs) are able to present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The TA programme intends to achieve this by providing practical and effective support to lending operations through a three-pronged approach to support FIs:
— Component 1: Design and deliver training programmes focusing on credit risk management as well as on banking and administrative risk management to FIs,
— Component 2: Provide targeted capacity building via consulting interventions for each FI,

— Component 3: Organise a series of MSME support actions aimed at raising the level of financial literacy, improving managerial capacity and building entrepreneurship skills of potential financial beneficiaries in order to help them present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The abovementioned components shall be implemented by a team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialised in microfinance with the following areas of expertise:
— Product diversification,
— Downscaling,
— Social performance management,
— The provision of non-financial services,
— MSME business development.
The selected contractor will be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The TA programme will be headed up from the Eastern Neighbourhood (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years from date of signature.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: April 2018
None

Regulation (EC) nº 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument and the Agreement of 26.1.2009, concluded between the European Commission, on behalf of the European Communities, Donor Member States and the European Investment Bank as Trust Fund Manager, on the establishment and the implementation rules of the Neighbourhood Investment Facility Trust Fund.

— Component 3: Organise a series of MSME support actions aimed at raising the level of financial literacy, improving managerial capacity and building entrepreneurship skills of potential financial beneficiaries in order to help them present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The abovementioned components shall be implemented by a team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialised in microfinance with the following areas of expertise:
— Product diversification,
— Downscaling,
— Social performance management,
— The provision of non-financial services,
— MSME business development.
The selected contractor will be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The TA programme will be headed up from the Eastern Neighbourhood (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years from date of signature.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: April 2018
None

Regulation (EC) nº 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument and the Agreement of 26.1.2009, concluded between the European Commission, on behalf of the European Communities, Donor Member States and the European Investment Bank as Trust Fund Manager, on the establishment and the implementation rules of the Neighbourhood Investment Facility Trust Fund.

TI_DOC.P: EIB - Eastern Neighbourhood Microfinance TA Programme (LU-Luxembourg)

TXT_MARK.P: TA2018018 R0 NIF
Restricted international tender
Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
General Budget of the Union through the Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
Fee-based

The following TA programme is linked to the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area (DCFTA) Agreement, signed between the European Commission (EC) and the European Investment Bank (EIB) on 19.12.2016. The DCFTA Initiative East is a facility aimed at supporting economic growth and employment-generating activities in Georgia, Ukraine and Moldova. The DCFTA facility comprises customised technical assistance to counterpart Financial Institutions (FIs) in the 3 aforementioned countries.
The main purpose of this technical assistance is to ensure that:
i. Loans are fully allocated to creditworthy micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs);
ii. The FIs are sustainable organisations capable to continue MSME lending after project completion and are able to diversify their range of financial services and products to this market segment;
iii. The final beneficiaries (MSMEs) are able to present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The TA programme intends to achieve this by providing practical and effective support to lending operations through a three-pronged approach to support FIs:
— Component 1: Design and deliver training programmes focusing on credit risk management as well as on banking and administrative risk management to FIs,
— Component 2: Provide targeted capacity building via consulting interventions for each FI,

— Component 3: Organise a series of MSME support actions aimed at raising the level of financial literacy, improving managerial capacity and building entrepreneurship skills of potential financial beneficiaries in order to help them present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The abovementioned components shall be implemented by a team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialised in microfinance with the following areas of expertise:
— Product diversification,
— Downscaling,
— Social performance management,
— The provision of non-financial services,
— MSME business development.
The selected contractor will be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The TA programme will be headed up from the Eastern Neighbourhood (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years from date of signature.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: April 2018
None

i. Loans are fully allocated to creditworthy micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs);
ii. The FIs are sustainable organisations capable to continue MSME lending after project completion and are able to diversify their range of financial services and products to this market segment;
iii. The final beneficiaries (MSMEs) are able to present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The TA programme intends to achieve this by providing practical and effective support to lending operations through a three-pronged approach to support FIs:
— Component 1: Design and deliver training programmes focusing on credit risk management as well as on banking and administrative risk management to FIs,
— Component 2: Provide targeted capacity building via consulting interventions for each FI,

— Component 3: Organise a series of MSME support actions aimed at raising the level of financial literacy, improving managerial capacity and building entrepreneurship skills of potential financial beneficiaries in order to help them present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The abovementioned components shall be implemented by a team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialised in microfinance with the following areas of expertise:
— Product diversification,
— Downscaling,
— Social performance management,
— The provision of non-financial services,
— MSME business development.
The selected contractor will be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The TA programme will be headed up from the Eastern Neighbourhood (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years from date of signature.

MLI_OCCUR.TI_MARK: Intended timing of publication of the procurement notice

TXT_MARK.P: April 2018
None

Regulation (EC) nº 1638/2006 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 24.10.2006 laying down general provisions establishing a European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument and the Agreement of 26.1.2009, concluded between the European Commission, on behalf of the European Communities, Donor Member States and the European Investment Bank as Trust Fund Manager, on the establishment and the implementation rules of the Neighbourhood Investment Facility Trust Fund.

TI_DOC.P: EIB - Eastern Neighbourhood Microfinance TA Programme (LU-Luxembourg)

TXT_MARK.P: TA2018018 R0 NIF
Restricted international tender
Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
General Budget of the Union through the Neighbourhood Investment Facility (NIF)
Fee-based

The following TA programme is linked to the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area (DCFTA) Agreement, signed between the European Commission (EC) and the European Investment Bank (EIB) on 19.12.2016. The DCFTA Initiative East is a facility aimed at supporting economic growth and employment-generating activities in Georgia, Ukraine and Moldova. The DCFTA facility comprises customised technical assistance to counterpart Financial Institutions (FIs) in the 3 aforementioned countries.
The main purpose of this technical assistance is to ensure that:
i. Loans are fully allocated to creditworthy micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs);
ii. The FIs are sustainable organisations capable to continue MSME lending after project completion and are able to diversify their range of financial services and products to this market segment;
iii. The final beneficiaries (MSMEs) are able to present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The TA programme intends to achieve this by providing practical and effective support to lending operations through a three-pronged approach to support FIs:
— Component 1: Design and deliver training programmes focusing on credit risk management as well as on banking and administrative risk management to FIs,
— Component 2: Provide targeted capacity building via consulting interventions for each FI,

— Component 3: Organise a series of MSME support actions aimed at raising the level of financial literacy, improving managerial capacity and building entrepreneurship skills of potential financial beneficiaries in order to help them present eligible income generating projects to FIs.
The abovementioned components shall be implemented by a team of long-term, intermittent and short-term experts specialised in microfinance with the following areas of expertise:
— Product diversification,
— Downscaling,
— Social performance management,
— The provision of non-financial services,
— MSME business development.
The selected contractor will be requested to oversee the whole programme as well as coordinate and supervise the provision of the above TA components.
The TA programme will be headed up from the Eastern Neighbourhood (location to be determined), for a period of 3 years from date of signature.
